I spend a lot of time reading online comics. My favorite of all time is MegaTokyo. It's a great, in depth story with a wide variety of characters (yay Miho!) so you can find the one who is most like you (apparently Piro according to those "Who are you" tests). There's great humour (Largo's apparent indistructibility, but continued bad luck springs to mind immediately), some romance (okay Piro ask her out already) and oh, did i mention the story. Great writing on the part of Fred "Piro" Gallagher. Wish i could actually get to one of the cons so i could meet this guy. Visit the comic urlLink MegaTokyo - relax, we understand j00 I recommend it (if ya hadn't noticed)

Warhammer Hordes of Chaos Post :) Well i found out on monday why people hate fighting Chaos in Warhammer. I played one of the Storm of Chaos events at my local gaming store and after worrying about the Bretonnian charge, which promptly wiped out a vast quantity of my army. My Chaos Knights joined in the fray and fear overwelmed the enemies as they ran before my advance. When they did hit my knights, they kinda.... bounced off. My nasty hell cannon made all his archers run off the board, but then ate it's crew.... went very slowly and couldn't get anywhere. My first victory!!! Mwahahahaha! It came down to the scenario victory points and i won. Anywho, back to work, no more play...
